subject: Management
title: The Status Quo Bias
description: A 60-second lesson on The Status Quo Bias.

hook.text: Organ donation rates in Austria: 99%. In Germany: 12%. The only difference: the default option on a form.

buildup.text: Humans have a powerful bias toward the current state. Change requires effort. Staying doesn't.

discovery.text: Kahneman: losses loom larger than gains. People fear what they'll lose more than they want what they'll gain.

twist.text: Logic alone won't overcome status quo bias. You must make the new way easier than the old way.

climax.text: Reduce friction for the new behavior. Increase friction for the old one. Design the default.

punchline.text: People don't resist change. They resist effort. Lower the effort.

quiz.question: What is the status quo bias?
options: A tendency to prefer the current state because change requires effort and feels risky
A rational evaluation that the current state is always the best option
A bias that only affects organizations, not individual decisions
